nodes.bodyText:
Does this mean we previously offered in autocompletion bigger snippet, e.g. if then else but now we will offer just single words if, then and else separately?
Or the row notation is just tricky and no change, but amount of words.
here it shouldn't be keyword rather than function?
also here maybe variable instead of function?
is it fine we do not use whole FEEL_RESERVED_KEYWORDS
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -364,40 +411,43 @@ public void testGetSuggestions() {
                 asList("upper case(string)", "upper case($1)"),
                 asList("week of year(date)", "week of year($1)"),
                 asList("years and months duration(from, to)", "years and months duration($1, $2)"));
-        final List<String> variableSuggestions = asList(
-                "Decision-1",
-                "Decision-2",

-        when(this.variableSuggestions.getSuggestions()).thenReturn(variableSuggestions);
+    private List<String> buildKeywordSuggestions() {

+                "in",
+                "or",
+                "and",
+                "between",
+                "if",
+                "then",
+                "else",
+                "for",
+                "return"

nodes.bodyText: yes it is only a sample of data. Do you think we need to put all reserved keywords there?
